title: Fat Studies and Health at Every Size: Bigness Beyond Obesity
abstractText: Over the course of 2010 - 2012, an interdisciplinary seminar series took place in the UK, addressing critical questions about the politics surrounding fatness and health. This series consisted of four seminars involving academics, policy makers, practitioners, activists, students and interested individuals. The interdisciplinary team involved in organising this series were from disciplinary backgrounds including: geography, sociology, women's studies, dietetics, nursing and midwifery, education, and sports and exercise science.
findingsText: Reported under RES-451-26-0768-A Reported under RES-451-26-0768-A Other
